column3: Understanding and sharing the feelings, perspectives, and concerns of others. The club organizes workshops and discussions to foster emotional intelligence and create a supportive community. Activities include empathy circles, mental health awareness campaigns, and peer support groups.

Connecting self-awareness with empathy to nurture compassion. The club hosts cultural events and performances that highlight the importance of emotional connection and cultural understanding. Activities include dance performances, cultural exchange programs, and empathy-building workshops.

Building stronger relationships through emotional insight and care. The club also focuses on coding competitions, hackathons, and collaborative projects to enhance technical skills and teamwork. Activities include coding bootcamps, tech talks, and collaborative software development projects.

Supports underprivileged but talented students in their education journey. The club provides scholarships, tutoring, and mentorship programs to help students achieve academic success. Activities include study groups, career counseling sessions, and fundraising events for educational resources.

Celebrates UNO-declared days with student-led activities to enhance communication and leadership. The club also organizes quizzes, debates, and seminars to broaden students' knowledge. Activities include trivia nights, leadership workshops, and international day celebrations.

Improves communication skills and general knowledge through newspaper-based learning activities. The club also conducts workshops on media literacy and current affairs. Activities include newspaper analysis sessions, mock press conferences, and debates on current events.

Provides a platform to discuss social issues while showcasing diverse student talents. The club organizes cultural festivals, talent shows, and open forums for social discourse. Activities include open mic nights, social issue panels, and cultural performances.

Organizes performing arts and craft activities for a vibrant campus experience. The club also hosts exhibitions and workshops to promote creativity and artistic expression. Activities include art and craft workshops, cultural performances, and DIY craft sessions.

Encourages reading habits through fiction and non-fiction books and events. The club also organizes book clubs, author talks, and literary festivals. Activities include book discussions, reading challenges, and literary workshops.

Teaches photography techniques and covers college events. The club also hosts photo walks, exhibitions, and competitions to showcase student work. Activities include photography workshops, photo editing sessions, and photography contests.

Engages in charity activities like blood donation and providing essentials to the needy. The club also organizes community service projects and awareness campaigns. Activities include food drives, clothing donation camps, and health awareness workshops.

Develops leadership and communication skills through speeches and team guidance. The club also offers public speaking workshops and networking opportunities. Activities include speech contests, leadership seminars, and networking events.

Promotes Indian Classical Music and trains students in basic music skills. The club also organizes concerts, music workshops, and collaborations with other cultural clubs. Activities include music theory classes, instrument training sessions, and cultural music performances.

Encourages students in painting and showcases their work on special occasions. The club also hosts art competitions, exhibitions, and interactive sessions with professional artists. Activities include painting workshops, art exhibitions, and live painting sessions.

Fosters creativity, reading habits, and proactive thinking through activities. The club also organizes brainstorming sessions, innovation challenges, and startup workshops. Activities include idea pitching competitions, creative problem-solving workshops, and innovation fairs.

Raises awareness about environmental protection and chemistry-related works. The club also conducts tree plantation drives, recycling initiatives, and environmental workshops. Activities include eco-friendly campaigns, waste management workshops, and sustainability projects.

Focuses on acting and drama performances to enhance students' theatrical skills. The club also organizes theater workshops, scriptwriting sessions, and stage performances. Activities include drama rehearsals, improvisation workshops, and theater competitions.

Encourages teamwork in technical projects and skill enhancement through hands-on experience. The club also hosts tech fairs, project showcases, and collaborative engineering challenges. Activities include robotics workshops, hardware prototyping sessions, and technical project exhibitions.

column1: Indian Society for Technical Education (ISTE) Club
column3: The ISTE Club aims to develop skilled engineers, technicians, and managers. It enhances teaching methods and provides training for educators. The club connects academia with industry for practical learning. It promotes curriculum updates to adapt to changing conditions.

column2: The college runs from 9 AM to 4 PM.
The college is located in Bhimavaram,which belongs to west Godavari district, Andhra Pradesh state, India.

column1: What courses does the college offer?
column2: The college offers B.Tech, M.Tech, MBA, and other courses.

column1: Is the college affiliated with any university?
column2: Yes, the college is affiliated with JNTU Kakinada.

column1: What is the official website of the college?
How can I contact the college administration?
column2: You can contact the administration via email at info@svecw.edu.in or call +91-1234567890.

column1: What is the admission process for undergraduate courses?
column2: Admission is based on entrance exams like EAMCET and merit.

column1: What is the admission process for postgraduate courses?
column2: Postgraduate admissions require GATE/PGCET scores and academic performance.

column1: Does the college provide management quota seats?
column2: Yes, management quota seats are available.

column1: What documents are required for admission?
column2: Required documents include 10th & 12th marksheets, entrance exam scorecard, ID proof, etc.

column1: What is the tuition fee for B.Tech courses?
column2: The tuition fee for B.Tech varies between ?80,000 - ?1,20,000 per year.

column1: What is the hostel fee per year?
column2: The hostel fee is starts around ?50,000 per year, including mess charges.

column1: Are there any scholarships available for students?
column2: Yes, merit-based and need-based scholarships are available.

column1: How can I apply for a scholarship?
column2: You can apply through the scholarship portal on the college website.

column1: Does the college offer any financial aid or fee waivers?
column2: Yes, the college provides financial aid for eligible students.

column1: Can I pay my fees in installments?
column2: Yes, fees can be paid in installments as per college policy.

column1: What is the fee refund policy in case of withdrawal?
column2: Fee refunds are subject to cancellation policies outlined by the college.

column1: Are there any additional charges apart from tuition and hostel fees?
column2: Additional charges may include exam fees, library fees, and lab fees.

column1: Is there a fee concession for meritorious students?
column2: Yes, students with high academic performance may get fee concessions.

column1: How can I get details about the fee structure?
column2: You can check the fee structure on the college website or contact administration.

column1: Does the college provide hostel facilities?
column2: Yes, separate hostels for boys and girls are available.

column1: What are the types of hostel rooms available?
column2: triple and four -sharing rooms are available.

column1: What is the mess fee structure?
column2: The mess fee is included in the hostel fee and provides vegetarian and non-vegetarian meals.

column1: What are the hostel rules and regulations?
column2: Hostel rules include maintaining discipline, attendance, and curfew timings.

column1: Is there a curfew for hostel students?
column2: Yes, hostel students must return by 9 PM daily.

column1: What facilities are available in the hostel rooms?
column2: Hostel rooms include beds, study tables, fans, and Wi-Fi.

column1: Are hostel rooms allocated based on merit?
column2: No, hostel room allocation is based on availability.
Yes, roommates are of their Choice.

column1: Are there separate hostels for boys and girls?
column2: Yes, there are separate hostels for boys and girls.

column1: What security measures are taken in hostels?
column2: Hostels have 24/7 security and CCTV surveillance.

column1: What is the placement record of the college?
column2: The placement record is around 85-90% every year.

column1: Which companies visit the campus for placements?
column2: Top recruiters include TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Visa, IBM

column1: What is the highest package offered in placements?
column2: The highest package offered was ?41 LPA.

column1: What is the average placement package?
column2: The average package is around ?4-5 LPA.

column1: Does the college provide internship opportunities?
column2: Yes, students get internship opportunities in their 3rd and 4th year.

column1: Is there any training for placement preparation?
column2: Yes, placement training includes aptitude, coding, and soft skills.

column1: How can students apply for campus placements?
column2: Students can register through the college placement cell.

column1: What is the eligibility criteria for placements?
column2: Minimum eligibility is 60% aggregate and no active backlogs.

column1: Are there any placement training programs?
column2: Yes, placement training is provided from the 2nd year onwards.

column1: What sports facilities are available on campus?
column2: The college provides cricket, football, basketball, badminton, and athletics facilities.

column1: Does the college have a gym?
column2: Yes, the college has a well-equipped gym for students.

column1: Is there a library? What are the library timings?
column2: Yes, the library is open from 8 AM to 12 PM on Working Hours. There is also digital library from 8:00 AM to 12:00 Night. On Holidays and Sundays the library is available form 8:00 AM to 10:00 pm.

column1: What are the transportation facilities provided by the college?
column2: The college provides bus transportation across multiple cities.

column1: Does the college have medical facilities?
column2: Yes, there is a medical center on campus for students.

column1: Are there any student clubs or cultural societies?
column2: Yes, various clubs like coding, dance, music, and cultural clubs exist.
Students can participate in tech fests, sports meets, and cultural events.

column1: Does the college have Wi-Fi on campus?
column2: Yes, the campus has high-speed Wi-Fi facilities.

column1: Is there a cafeteria or food court on campus?
column2: Yes, there is a cafeteria offering multi-cuisine food.

column1: Are there any annual fests or cultural events?
column2: Yes, the college organizes annual fests, cultural events, and technical symposiums.

column1: What are the food canteens other than the mess where students or faculty can go and eat?
column2:
The huge campus has got Food Courts at twelve different locations, occasionally alluring students and faculty for taste of food items. Thus, these places provide them an opportunity to eat out just to deviate from their monotonous routine. These food courts areopen from 6.30a.m. to 8.30p.m. They are: BakersTreat,Tasty Corner,Nescafe Coffee Shops,Fresh Choice Bakery at Lake View,Lake View Court,
Jercy Juicy Shop and Fast Food Items, Annapurna Fast Food Items Fresh Choice at Temple Square,Snacks Corner,Juice Shop and Fast Foods,Annapurna Canteen

column1: Describe the facilities and resources available in the library and the types of Collections?
column2: The air-conditioned library spans three floors with an area of 1083 sq.m. and is secured with a security system. It houses 59,721 volumes of books, 1,380 journal back volumes, 4,000 CDs, and 250 audio cassettes, covering Engineering & Technology, Basic Sciences, and Management Sciences.
Yes, the SVECW houses an Indoor Auditorium, Open-Air-Auditorium, Mini-Auditorium and numerous Seminar Halls.

column1: Is Wifi available in the College?
column2: The campus has a strong IT infrastructure supporting 3000+ terminals and a large Wi-Fi network. It features 20+ Wi-Fi access points, 86 Mbps internet, 1000+ workstations, IBM servers for redundancy, and a 10 km fiber backbone for 1GB connectivity. A D-Link core switch manages traffic, while a Cyberome firewall and 30+ CCTV cameras ensure security. A 320 KVA UPS provides 24/7 power backup.

column1: What are the facilities of Hostel provided?
column2: Newspapers and educative periodicals are provided.A reading room or TV room is provided.

column1: Is Health Care Centre is available in College
column2: Yes, All types of medical advice,clincial tests and inpatient facility with two beds. Thecentre is monitored by a resident general physician Dr. Varaprasad, a psychiatrist Dr. RamaKrishnam Raju and a gynaecologist Dr.JayaKumari visit the centre during their appointed hours.

column1: What are the Other Facilities available in College
column2: It contains a Bank and ATM's , Post Office , Power Backup and Mineral Water Plant

Shri Vishnu Engineering College for Women is located in Bhimavaram, Andhra Pradesh, on a 100-acre campus in Vishnupur, 3 km from the city. Known for its serene environment, the college offers modern infrastructure, including labs, lecture halls, and sports facilities, supporting academic and personal development. Regular upgrades ensure the campus remains conducive to learning and growth.

column1: What are the training programs that are conducted for Student placements?
column2: Smart Interviews conducts the CNDS(C and Data Structures) program to prepare students for DSA and CRT(Campus Recruitment Training) Program to make students learn Aptitude

column1: What are Strategic plan or Action Plan of SVECW?
column2:
1. Improve education through innovative practices, certifications, and expert involvement.  
2. Enhance employability via industry ties, placements, and competitive exam training.  
3. Support faculty development and research culture.  
4. Promote community service and eco-friendly initiatives.

column4:
The hostel has 20 well-ventilated rooms, each equipped with 4 beds and 2 ceiling fans.
Each room features an attached washroom, along with cooling and hot water facilities,
ensuring a comfortable stay for all residents.

Narmada hostel offers 30 rooms, similar in setup to Yamuna hostel.
Each room accommodates 4 beds, has 2 ceiling fans, and includes an attached washroom.
Cooling and hot water facilities are also provided for the convenience of residents.

Sindhu hostel consists of 30 spacious rooms, each designed to accommodate 5 students.
Each room includes 2 attached washrooms, 3 ceiling fans, and dedicated study tables.
This setup provides ample space for both relaxation and academic activities.

Ganga hostel mirrors the facilities of Sindhu hostel with 30 well-furnished rooms.
Each room is designed for 5 students, featuring 2 attached washrooms, 3 ceiling fans,
and study tables to support academic and personal needs.

Medha hostel provides both 3-bed and 4-bed room configurations, depending on room size.
All rooms include an attached washroom, 3 ceiling fans, and study tables,
ensuring a balance between shared living and personal comfort.

Medha AC hostel offers air-conditioned rooms with either 3 or 4 beds per room.
Each room is equipped with an attached washroom, 3 ceiling fans, and study tables,
providing a comfortable and study-friendly environment.

Sarada hostel consists of 40 rooms, each designed for 4 students.
Each room is equipped with 2 ceiling fans, and residents have access to a common washroom.
The hostel ensures a well-maintained and hygienic living space for students.

Vaishnavi hostel comprises 40 rooms, each offering accommodation for 4 residents.
Each room is equipped with 2 ceiling fans, and a common washroom facility is available.
This setup ensures both comfort and convenience for students.

Manasa hostel has 20 well-maintained rooms, similar in structure to Yamuna hostel.
Each room is furnished with 4 beds, 2 ceiling fans, and an attached washroom.
Cooling and hot water facilities are also provided for added comfort.

Bhuvana hostel features 20 rooms, each accommodating 4 students.
Rooms are equipped with 2 ceiling fans, attached washrooms, and access to cooling & hot water facilities.
This hostel offers a well-balanced environment for studying and living.

Neelima hostel consists of 20 rooms, each designed for 4 occupants.
Every room has 2 ceiling fans, an attached washroom, and access to cooling and hot water facilities.
This ensures a comfortable and conducive environment for students.
It has 30 rooms with 4 beds and 2 Fans in each room. Attached Washrooms are available and Study table for each student.

Rajeswari hostel consists of 30 rooms, each designed for 4-bed occupancy.
Rooms are equipped with 2 ceiling fans, attached washrooms, and study tables,
providing students with a comfortable and focused living space.

Pragathi hostel features 20 rooms, each accommodating 4 beds.
Every room has 2 ceiling fans, ensuring proper ventilation.
Hot water and cooling water facilities are available to ensure a comfortable stay.

Seetha hostel comprises 30 rooms, each designed for 5-bed occupancy.
Each room includes 2 attached washrooms, 3 ceiling fans, and study tables,
providing a spacious and study-friendly environment for residents.
20 Rooms with 4 beds and 2 Fans in each room. Fridge and attached Washrooms are available
